entry.title: Mass migration of master data and fixed asset postings
entry.content:
I have a new customer for whom we will implement SAP Public Cloud. Among their data, there are 350,000 fixed assets that need to be migrated, including both master data and postings. The upload files are much larger than the 160 MB limit allowed by the Migration Cockpit. I performed a test load in the starter system with 50,000 assets, and it took 14 hours; for postings, it only allowed me to load 45,000.

Is there any way to migrate all this information through a BAdI or API?

#Cloud #fixedasset #massive #migration

entry.title: How to display delivery number into Freight Order "Item" tab?
entry.content:
Hello,

 

My customer creates their Freight Orders manually and add the right Freight Units into them manually as well.

It needs to add Containers and assign FU to the right containers. They need to do it based on the delivery number. Unfortunately, the delivery number is not available into the "Item" tab of the Freight Order document. We can only have FU number which is not really relevant.

It is possible to add the delivery number here for each FU ?

 

Thanks you a lot!

entry.title: CPI HTTP Receiver always returns 400 ‚ÄúSyntax Error‚Äù although same JSON works in Postman
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

We are trying to call a BZSt REST endpoint from SAP Cloud Integration (CPI) using the HTTP Receiver adapter. The goal is to send a small JSON request from our SAP backend to the German EVATR service and receive a validation response.

The same request (same URL, same JSON body, same token/parameters) works perfectly in Postman. In CPI, however, we consistently receive an HTTP 400 error from the target system.

The error message in the CPI log is:

org.apache.camel.component.ahc.AhcOperationFailedException:
HTTP operation failed invoking https://api.evatr.vies.bzst.de/app/v1/abfrage with statusCode: 400

 The response body from the server is an HTML error page:

<html>
<head>
<base href="/error_path/">
<title>400 Bad Request</title>
</head>
<body>
<h1>Bad Request</h1>
<p>The server detected a syntax error in your request.<br>
Check your request and all parameters.</p>

<p>Your request ID was: aSW1_biQek9iXbaem_MTxwAABZY</p>
</body>
</html>

In the meantime, we have tested quite a lot of variations. We tried many different header combinations, including explicitly setting headers like Content-Type, Accept, Host, and Content-Length, and we experimented with the ‚ÄúAllowed / Request Headers‚Äù setting of the HTTP Receiver adapter (including using *). None of these attempts changed the behavior ‚Äì CPI still only seems to forward a very small set of headers, and additional headers set via a Content Modifier often do not appear in the actual outbound call (according to the HTTP_Receiver_Adapter_Request_Headers attachment).

We also experimented with the payload itself: different JSON formats, slightly modified test payloads, sending the exact same body as Postman, and even building a minimal iFlow where the JSON body is hard-coded in a Content Modifier and sent directly to the HTTP receiver. The result is always the same 400 response from the BZSt service, so it does not appear to be a simple syntax issue in the JSON itself.

What could be the reason for this behavior, and does anyone know how to resolve it or what else we should check?

Here is how the iFlow is built and the error messages:

entry.title: How to handle the exception CX_RAP_HANDLER_NOT_IMPLEMENTED with the reason Handler not implemented;
entry.content:

I did some fixes and activated several (but accidentily not all üòâ) objects including the service binding.

When trying to create a new entity I received the following error analyis in the dump.

Error analysis

The program has indicated exception "CX_SADL_DUMP_APPL_MODEL_ERROR" as the reason for the
termination:
Processing was aborted because of an application modeling error: See previous in exception chain.
The exception is related to the previous exception "CX_RAP_HANDLER_NOT_IMPLEMENTED" that occurred in
program "CL_RAP_BHV_PROCESSOR==========CP", in line 30 of include "CL_RAP_BHV_PROCESSOR==========CM01G". The reason for this exception
was:
Handler not implemented; Method: GLOBAL_AUTHORIZATION, Involved Entities: ZC_AC000000UXX

entry.title: Re: How to handle the exception CX_RAP_HANDLER_NOT_IMPLEMENTED with the reason Handler not implement
entry.content:
The root cause for the problem was that the behavior implementation class

ZDMOBP_R_SALESORDER_01

was not activated which is specified in the behavior definition as follows:  

managed implementation in class ZDMOBP_R_SALESORDER_01 unique;

After fixing additional errors that prevented the activation of the behavior pool the fiori elements preview worded as expected.

entry.title: Automation of Trust Setting, Role Collections, and IAS User Groups in SAP Cloud Identity Services
entry.content:
BTP-based applications that use the XSUAA service for user management must ensure that XSUAA role collections are created and published to the Identity Directory Service (IdDS) during tenant provisioning.

During provisioning role collections must be

  • be created in the XSUAA service instance
  • ensure mappings between role collections and IdDS groups are established
  • published to the Identity Directory Service (IdDS)

In Unified Services, the root entity of the domain model is the Organization. The structure itself is a hierarchy of folders and resource groups under the Organization entity. The pre-requisite here is to have a Provider App folder. Each app provider must have a folder (namely a ‚Äúprovider folder‚Äù) that represents their app, mainly to act as a container for all Unified Services‚Äô related resources. For detailed guide Unified Services Documentation 

üéØGoal

Seamlessly provision the Resource Management application's authorization model into a customer‚Äôs IAS tenant and enable automatic role-to-group mapping and user group assignment during onboarding of customers. The pre-requisite here is to have the folder setup for the application & the automation solution is setup

Step 1: Establish Trust between customer's IAS Tenant and the SAP Managed Customer Sub-account using UCA

The Trust Setup module builds an OIDC-based secure connection between the sub-account and an identity provider (IDP).

Assuming automation solution is loaded into the CAD, drag and drop the ``` Trust Setup ``` module from the available modules onto the CAD tool. The configuration details for the trust setup like the IAS tenant Host and other parameters can be configured in the panel. Please Note a dependency must be set as the trust setup module should be processed only after the sub-account creation is successful.

Step 2: Role collection creation

The role collection module when added to the CAD automates the creation of role collection for the roles your application delivers. The role to role collection mapping can be done through a list of roles and the role collection.
Ex - [{"role_name":"Manager","role_template_name":"Manager","xsappname":"your-app-name"}]

Please Note that the role collection module should be added after the subscription is successful.

 

Step 3: IAS User Group Creation

The automatic creation of user group and the mapping of the IAS User group to the Role collection is handled using this module.
The User Group name needs to be tagged to the role collection, inside the role collection configuration.

This will result in the automatic creation of role collections, user groups and also the mapping between those. The user group could be seen in the console of the Cloud Identity Services of the customer tenant.

entry.title: Re: Plant Abroad BE
entry.content:
Hello @sanne_larsen 

Based on your description, I believe the issue lies in activating Belgium.

The public cloud allows you to operate a plant in a foreign country without creating a company code in that country. The foreign country (in your case Belgium) must be activated in scoping because you can only create plants in activated countries.

This blog Understanding Country/Region-Specific Scoping and Configuration in Central Business Configuration provides some good details.

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP PUPM Business AI: what does it cost to run ONE AI feature ONE time?
entry.content:
@sitapati2  Thanks for the question!  Answer: If, for example, the customer uses 56.000 requests (thus 4000 over), then this will cost 8 AI units extra.  Each 1000 requests have a cost of 2 AI unit as "overage of requests in Blocks of 1000".  This is listed in the screenshot in the blog post. 

So at the end of the month, the SAP system will consume an additional 8 AI units from the AI unit balance that the customer has.  This in in addition to the 10 person * 8 AI units per person = 80 units per month for the 10 PUPM users

entry.content:
Hi Community,

I need a help. While the Business Partner replication I've got an error F2 653 Personnel master record XXXX does not exist. I've found that to fix it I need to  Implement SAP Note 825416: Via transaction OOPC "Switch off personnel number check" in 'Personnel Management' customizing, you have set the flag to blank (off). 

Does anyone implement that note and it helps? Also what impact for other processes could be?

entry.title: New Learning Journey: Implementing SAP Commerce Cloud
entry.content:
We are excited to announce the launch of our extensive learning journey on learning.sap.com platform. 

Implementing SAP Commerce Cloud 

This step-by-step journey is designed to provide you with the advanced development skills and in-depth knowledge necessary to fully leverage SAP Commerce Cloud.

Target Audience

  • Developers
  • Technical Consultants

What will you learn:

The learning journey includes three sub-courses, each tailored to a different experience level:

  • Exploring the Technical Essentials of SAP Commerce Cloud: Let's start with the basics and the essential knowledge! After completing this course, you will understand the fundamental technical aspects (e.g. Data Modeling, Impex, Flexible Search, Service and  Facade layers etc.) of SAP Commerce Cloud and be able to provide configuration into SAP Commerce Cloud. You will also be able to develop and code the basic modules of SAP Commerce Cloud.
  • Expanding upon Technical Essentials of SAP Commerce Cloud: The journey continues with more in-depth knowledge. After completing this course, consultants and developers will learn how to deploy their solutions to the cloud and how to configure and customize key components of SAP Commerce Cloud.
  • Mastering the Technical Essentials of SAP Commerce Cloud: This is the final course in the series, and it is designed to complete the developer‚Äôs understanding of SAP Commerce Cloud capabilities. After completing this course, consultants and developers will be able to configure and extend advanced key features of the SAP Commerce Cloud solution, such as the storefront, promotions and coupons, search functionality, and web services.
     

Hands-on Practice Systems

To support your learning journey, we have enriched each course with a dedicated hands-on practice system. These systems are preconfigured with all the necessary data, allowing you to complete the designed exercises and experiment independently in practical scenarios. The practice systems require an SAP Learning Hub license.

Certification Opportunity

After completing this learning journey, you will be prepared to pursue the SAP Commerce Cloud Professional certification for developers, allowing you to validate your skills and knowledge.

Join us and unlock the full potential of SAP Commerce Cloud capabilities. Enroll now to begin your journey toward advanced customization and implementation with SAP Commerce Cloud.

entry.title: Re: Workforce replication from SuccessFactors to S4/Hana Public Cloud using Master Data Integration
entry.content:
Hi @kushal_Jag ,

Thank you..!

Yes, that can be done here as well. There are two approaches to achieve it:

  1. Utilizing MDI as a Hub: When Master Data Integration (MDI) is utilized as a hub for centralized master data, it has all necessary employee information. Within your distribution model, you have the ability to fine-tune the data replication by using include/exclude options available in Master Data Object (MDO) configurations.

  2. Filtering within SuccessFactors: Alternatively, you can apply data filters directly within the SuccessFactors business scenario. This approach allows you to specify the desired employee data criteria, ensuring that only relevant information is synchronized with your SAP systems.

Regards,

Kirthan

entry.title: Need help !!! Business partner XX does not exist as customer, change not possible
entry.content:
Hi experts,

While business partner data replication from CRM to S/4 I've got an error: Business partner XXX does not exist ascustomer, change not possible

During the RCA I've found that the fix is:

Manually update the required mapping tables to restore the BP-Customer relationship:‚Äã

  • CRMKUNNR ‚Äì Links the BP GUID to the corresponding Customer number.‚Äã
  • CRMM_BUT_CUSTNO ‚Äì Stores the BP number and associated Customer number.‚Äã

Could you please advice the way on mass tables update, also please tell me should I update them in dev, tes and then prod? Maybe anyone also faced with the same?

entry.title: Budget Availability Control for Project
entry.content:
Good afternoon, I am trying to configure budget control for a project in SAP Public Cloud.

Once I added the accounts I want to belong to the budget group to the YPS2 hierarchy and ran some tests, I noticed that if I posted an account that was not in that group, the system allowed me to post it, although obviously it did not deduct it from the budget.

For cost centers, I managed to solve this problem by setting up a group of accounts and adding all the accounts that did not belong to the control to it, so that when I posted, an error message appeared saying that there was no budget in that group.

For projects, I thought of the same solution, creating a semantic tag and setting it up in the profile, but when creating it, SAP only allows one semantic tag per profile.

Having explained my doubt, my question is clear: is there any way to do something similar to what I did in the cost center budgeting for projects?

Since I have seen that it is not possible through parameterization...

I am attaching images to provide more context.

Best regards

entry.title: Re: Onboarding - Your HR manager has requested a correction to your personal data

This is new as of this week from what I am able to see. but this is the first I am hearing of this issue with this one new hire. I do not know what is triggering this message - our HR manager has no task here as the message implies. Thank you for your help!

entry.title: Re: 999 ‚Äì The Number of the BSEG
entry.content:
Hello Jack,

yes, absolutely, you sort of got lucky here: EV_POSTNG_CTRL '2' will clear all fields of structure FINS_ACDOC_ITEM_ATTR_CO_GL, which does not include the functional area FKBER. So feeding the value '2' here will do exactly what returning the parameter EB_SUMMARIZE_ACCT_ASSIGNMENTS in the BAdi will do. We did this intentionally (not clearing the functional area) in OnPrem and Private Cloud, just to be a bit cautious ("maybe some customers want to perform some very basic P&L reporting on BSEG?") But allow me to say that it's a bit questionable to validate for a non-empty BSEG-FKBER. Why exactly do you need the functional area in the BSEG? It's clearly a P&L relevant field, and - as outlined before - BSEG should not be the source of any P&L reporting, ACDOCA should be the source. That's why in the Public Cloud we recently included the functional area as field to be cleared for summarization (when EV_POSTNG_CTRL = '2'). But in OnPrem and Private Cloud, it's not cleared.

Best regards, 

Stefan

entry.title: Autopath in IAG is not working for PAM requests
entry.content:
Dear colleagues,

We have activated the rulesets in SAP IAG so when a user creates an access requests and chooses 'AUTO_APPROVAL' as request reason, the autopath workflow (no approvers required) is used. 

This works fine for normal access requests, but if we request a PAM user, this message appears:

"PAM Assignment request cannot be auto approved. Please contact your IAG Administrator to correct the access request workflow configuration"

We have also tried with other different rule, which is based on the request type. In case it is 'PAM', the autopath is used. The behaviour is just like the one we have with the first case, same message. 

Is there any way in SAP IAG to activate auto-approvals for Privileged Accesses?

Thank you

Francisco

entry.title: Re: Post internal expenses (like repair expense) to AUC w...
entry.content:
Good day @Purandar 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Posting Post-Capitalization, External Asset Acquisitions, Assets Under Construction: Management and Settlement, Transferring Assets Under Construction

Please note that you must post all asset through a subledger controlled process. This is why you cannot use Post General Journal Entries to credit expense and debit AUC.

In summary, because G/L accounts are asset reconciliation accounts, the public cloud due to its clean-core principles, does not allow you to post project costs manually to an AUC through journal entries. However, you can either use Post Capitalization or Asset Acquisition apps to achieve your goal of debiting the AUC and crediting expense G/L accounts without requiring vendor or PO data. That means after you complete your project, you settle the AUC to the final intangible asset using standard settlement app.

Have a look at Blog: Post-Capitalization in Asset Accounting for some more details.

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Save the Date: SAP Academic Community Conference Latin America & the Caribbean 2026
entry.content:
Get ready, academic community!

The much-anticipated SAP Academic Community Conference Latin America & Caribbean is returning in 2026, in a new format. This annual gathering is a cornerstone for universities, partners, and industry leaders to share experiences, foster innovation, and cultivate collaboration across the globe. Next year, S√£o Leopoldo, Brazil, will proudly host this event, offering you an unparalleled opportunity to be a part of transformative conversations.

Mark Your Calendars:

üìÖ Dates: May 19‚Äì21, 2026
üìç Location: S√£o Leopoldo, Brazil

This exclusive format will unite the entirety of the Latin America and Caribbean academic community for three days filled with learning, networking, and inspiration. For anyone passionate about advancing education through technology, this is an event you won't want to miss.

What to Expect?

  • Inspiring Keynotes and Panels: Hear from thought leaders and innovators who are shaping the future of academia and technology. Their insights will surely ignite your passion and maybe even spark groundbreaking ideas of your own!
  • Hands-On Workshops and Sessions: Roll up your sleeves and dive deep into the latest SAP technologies and methodologies. With practical workshops designed to guide your learning and elevate your skills, you‚Äôll leave equipped with knowledge ready to be applied in classrooms and institutions.
  • Networking Opportunities: Whether it‚Äôs during a casual coffee break or at a workshop, connect and exchange ideas with peers, educators and SAP professionals. These interactions can lead to fruitful partnerships and collaborations.

Stay tuned for more updates on the conference agenda, registration details, and event logistics. This is your chance to engage with the academic and tech community on a deeper level while enjoying the enchanting atmosphere of S√£o Leopoldo.

So, save the date! Let‚Äôs come together to drive learning, networking, and collaboration forward.

entry.title: Re: The lease invoice is not created.
entry.content:

entry.title: Re: Build 8228/8229 Enhancements To Unload/Reload DB Lowe...
entry.content: Chris, thanks for the reply. I didn't quite clarify well in my OP, we did confirm that there were no unintended deletes, so that's obviously the most important thing. I was able to reproduce what I encountered. Grabbed a backup (12.8 GB DB / 790 MB LOG) that was previously running on Build 8039. Put the same build on a server we weren't using and re-executed the same deletes. The difference seems to be whether or not I stop our SQL Anywhere Windows Service before unloading and reloading, and I'm honestly surprised I've never noticed this before, or I'm just forgetting because I typically will stop the service beforehand. After re-executing the deletes, the source DB grew to 16.7 GB DB / 1.87 GB LOG. Immediate unload/reload into a new DB gives me a 6.4 GB DB. Stopped the service, source DB dropped to 12.9 GB DB / 1.87 GB LOG. Started service back up, did unload/reload again which gives me 4.4 GB. So, I guess, totally different question now - Why the different behavior after restarting the Windows service?

entry.title: Re: Migrating to Crystal 64-bit questions
entry.content:
Just one small addition: The later versions of Visual studio does not take the old APIs insistence on byte padding so to compile under VS2022 you need to do this:

#pragma pack(push, 8 )

#include <windows.h>

#pragma pack(pop)

#include "ufls/ufdllunicode.h"

#include "ufmain.h" #etc

That sets the packing to windows default which is 8 and then back to 1

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud: Disassembly Production Order
entry.content:
Hello @Peng_Biao  @Chris1973 ,

I have the same issue, and when creating a production order using 'Production Order without Material - Create' (transaction CO07), I only have the following questions: Upon completing the production order, when viewing the "Manage Production Orders" monitor:

1. The production order status remains "Confirmed," and the "Open Quantity" column still shows 1 piece.

Is this normal? Will it affect anything if I leave it as is?

2. In a standard production order, the status ends with "Delivered," and the "Open Quantity" is zero.

 

3. I've attached an image showing that when I access the order, I can mark it as "Delivery Completed." This changes the status to "Confirmed," but the "Open Quantity" column still shows 1 piece.

Is this normal? Will it affect anything if I leave it as is?

 

 

I also noticed that by default, it's marked as "GR Non-Valued." Will this affect my accounting?

Thank you for your comments.

entry.title: Re: Reimagining Certification for the Way We Work Today
entry.content:
Hi @DianaRoesner and all in this community,

Thank you very much indeed for the clear guidance!

I am very grateful and delighted to inform you that I passed 2 Scenario-based certifications C_RISEME and P_BTPA within 2 days and got high/pass scores on very first attempt.

Of course, it was a new, surreal experience interacting with Yoodli ! Even better would be clearer guardrails (such as ID verification) and clarity/ practice sessions to set the stage and simplify the workflow for the 24hrs window exam attempt. 

I felt that the interactions with AI persona mirrored ones I have had with  senior leaders at my clients. In addition to core knowledge questions, some of the key metrics were coaching and analytics parts of the assessment focused on conciseness, showing interest in others , word choice, listening, presentation and delivery skills !

I was advised bySAP Learning Systems Engineering- Services & Support "score reports would be available from January 2026 onwards".

I rigorously followed approach to be in a isolated room, even with open book allowed to safeguard exam integrity.  (IMHO  basic Examination Rules must still be  the same regardless of AI-role play). https://cdn.training.sap.com/uploads/SAP_Consultant_Certification_Policy.pdf

I strongly believe this is the best way to validate ones learning journey!  Certification is only a middle-step in the continous learning journey at SAP even though I have now added 10 new SAP Certifications in past 4 years.

I was truly inspired by the amazing SAP community and benefits of the new SAP Certification approach during  live interactions with SAP  advocates and  mentors at SAP TechEd Berlin.

Warmest regards.

entry.title: Re: Database server type not supported
entry.content:
Good afternoon!

I know I came with the answer a little bit late üòÇ ‚Äå‚Äå, but for me, it worked installing the Microsoft ODBC Driver XX for SQL Server (the XX stands for the version that fits of your SQL Server, for example: ODBC Driver 13 for SQL Server -> SQL Server 2016).

Every machine that needs to connect to the SAP DB for whatever reason, needs to have this component installed.

Hope that fits for you.

entry.title: BiWhy ‚Äì OS Monitoring and BOBJ Metrics Synergy
entry.content:
Disclaimer:
BiWhy is available again for FREE to everyone on biwhy.net

During a system health check, we observed that BiPrecalculation.exe was the largest memory consumer, and its memory usage continuously increased without being released.
BOBJ metrics confirmed that the load was not growing, which strongly indicated a memory leak.

We warned the customer that servers running AO jobs might eventually run out of memory and proposed a simple workaround.

Workaround:
Reduce the parameter that automatically restarts the process after a specified number of processed requests.

3274298 - High memory consumption of BiPrecalculation.exe

https://me.sap.com/notes/3274298

 

Proper solution:
Open an SAP incident to fix the memory leak.

Unfortunately, the recommendations were not implemented, and exactly one year later the customer returned with the issue: their servers were running out of memory, just as predicted ‚Äì though this time the issue was resolved quickly.

Screenshots:

Content

  • BiPrecalculation.exe memory usage
  • Host memory impact caused by BiPrecalculation.exe
  • Requests to AO job process
  • AO jobs
  • Requests-per-process limit

 

BiPrecalculation.exe memory usage

Host memory impact caused by BiPrecalculation.exe

Requests to AO job process

AO jobs

Requests-per-process limit

entry.title: Struggling with GR/IR Differences during Invoice posts? Use the Invoice Posting Analysis report
entry.content:
Hey All,
 
Handling GR/IR (WRX) issues can be challenging, especially when unexpected balances appear after posting logistics invoice verification documents.
 
As someone who works closely with global support teams and customer scenarios, I see the same pattern: customers spend significant time trying to understand how SAP calculated the WRX (GR/IR clearing) amount.

 

The good news?
SAP provides a helpful analysis tool that is still not widely known:
üëâ Invoice Posting Analysis report: IV_WRX_ANALYSIS
 
This report is described in SAP Note 2427297 - Analysis report to explain GR/IR amount (WRX line item), and in this blog, I want to make it simple, visual, and practical, so more customers can use it with confidence.



What the Invoice Posting Analysis Report Does
 
The Invoice Posting Analysis report (IV_WRX_ANALYSIS) explains how the system calculated the amount posted to the GR/IR clearing account (transaction key WRX) during Logistics Invoice Verification.
 
It explains the logic for material and planned delivery costs items. The document types that can be analyzed are:
- Invoices
- Credit memos
- Subsequent debits
- Subsequent credits
- Account maintenance documents including documents with multiple account assignment
 
This makes it an extremely valuable tool when:
- You see a difference between the goods receipt and the invoice
- The WRX amount is not what you expected
- The invoice hits unexpected accounts
- You need to explain the calculation to business users or auditors



What the Report Does Not Cover
 
To set the right expectations, the report does not explain calculations for:
- Unplanned delivery cost
- Taxes in the WRX line
- Foreign currencies
- Account maintenance documents for account-assigned purchase orders
- Contract invoices
- Direct postings to material or G/L accounts
- It also does not explain the amounts calculated for price difference (PRD/KBS) or exchange rate difference (KDM) postings
 
If your case falls into one of these categories, you may still need a deeper analysis.
 
 
How to Implement the Report (Manual Installation)
 
Because Note 2427297 does not contain SNOTE correction instructions, the report must be implemented manually.

 

‚úîÔ∏èSteps to Implement:
1. Go to transaction SE38 or SE80.
2. Create the following includes exactly with these names:
- IV_WRX_ANALYSIS
- IV_WRX_ANALYSIS_TOP
3. Copy the source code from the attachments in Note 2427297 into the respective includes.
4. Activate both includes.

 

üîîTip:
If you have already implemented an older version of the report, simply replace the existing code with the latest version from the Note.
 
Once activated, you can run the report IV_WRX_ANALYSIS using the SE38 transaction.
 
 
How to Run and Use the Report
 
1Ô∏è‚É£ Execute the Report
Go to transaction SE38 ‚Üí enter IV_WRX_ANALYSIS ‚Üí Execute.
 
2Ô∏è‚É£Enter the Selection Criteria
You only need three inputs:
- Document Number
- Fiscal Year
- Document Item
 
 
This makes it quick and simple to use, even during high-pressure situations like month-end closing.
 
3Ô∏è‚É£Analyze the Output
The report displays three clear sections:
 
A) Invoice & PO Details
All relevant information the system considered for the calculation, such as:
- PO details: Net Value, Net Price, Quantity
- Invoice and Goods Receipt details (depending on the formula used and the scenario)
 
B) Calculation Logic
This is the heart of the report.
It shows:
- The formula used by the system
- All values used in the calculation (GR quantities, invoice amounts, and condition values for each account)
- The final calculated WRX (GR/IR) amount
 
This transparency makes it much easier to verify whether the calculated value is correct.
 
Important Note: You will see the calculated value of the GR/IR (WRX) clearing account posted during the Invoice Receipt process.
 
C) Documentation
A helpful reference section with links to related information.
 

Image/data in this blog is from SAP internal systems, sample data, or demo systems. Any resemblance to real data is purely coincidental.

Why You Should Use This Report
 
The Invoice Posting Analysis report is one of the most effective tools for:
- Understanding complex WRX postings
- Reducing investigation time during closing
- Preparing clear explanations for business users, auditors, or finance teams
- Preventing unnecessary support cases
 
Still, many customers are not aware that this report exists, which is why I wanted to bring visibility to it!



Final Recommendation
 
If you work with Invoice Verification, other Procurement areas, or Finance, I highly encourage you to:
‚úîÔ∏èImplement the report manually (it only takes a few minutes)
‚úîÔ∏èUse it for each case where WRX amounts look unexpected
‚úîÔ∏èShare the Note 2427297 with your internal teams
‚úîÔ∏èAttach the report output when creating SAP Support cases
 
It will save you time, prevent misunderstandings, and bring full clarity to your GR/IR calculations.
 
If you have questions, need help implementing the report, or want to share feedback, feel free to leave a comment below.
 
It was nice to connect with you again üòâ
 
Best regards,
Carla Bussolo

entry.title: Sales withholding tax differences between SD/FI document
entry.content:
I've configured everything to calculate self-withholding tax from the SD module. The system correctly calculates the self-withholding tax in the SD document based on the net invoice value. Meanwhile, in FI, the accounting entry is for $65,000 COP.

Define Withholding tax

Assign conditions type to Withholding tax

entry.title: SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 + ESM - API Authentication Methods
entry.content:
This blog explores the authentication methods available for SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 APIs, especially when integrating with BTP, S4 HANA, external systems, ESM platforms.

Basic Authentication

Basic Authentication uses a username and password encoded in Base64. While simple, it is not recommended for production due to security risks unless combined with HTTPS.

GET {{url}}/sap/c4c/api/v1/iam-service/token
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Basic {{username}}:{{password}}

another API endpoint for token generate

GET {{url}}/auth/token
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Basic {{username}}:{{password}}

Refresh Token

once the token is expired and you can refersh the token

GET {{url}}/auth/token?grant_type=refresh_token
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer {{accessToken}}

Use the token in API requests (Authorization: Bearer <token>).

Password Authentication 

Steps to follow

  • Go to System Settings - Search for Integration
  • Create a New Communication System and Select Inbound
  • Enter the Display ID, Description and set the password (minimum 30chars)

Once activated, you will see userName which be same as DisplayID  you entered and password which is been set by you.

GET {{url}}/auth/token
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Basic {{username}}:{{password}}

Use the token in API requests (Authorization: Bearer <token>).

OAuth2 SAML Bearer Assertion Flow

The following steps describe how to connect a SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 system using the OAuth2 SAML Bearer Assertion Authentication flow. In this flow, the user identity of the logged-in user from source system can be propagated to SAP Sales and Service Cloud Version 2 system.

Steps to follow

  1. Login to your SAP BTP cockpit, and navigate to BTP Subaccount - Destinations  -  Download Trust
  2. Copy contents of the certificate between the header and the footer.

After export of the certificate, you will copy the certificate to cleartext and make below API call

POST {{url}}/sap/c4c/api/v1/iam-service/oauth2InboundConfiguration
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Basic {{user}}:{{password}}

{
    "id": "34f8b9d2-78c2-4617-bcf2-6eb36403c667",
    "clientAppName" : "<give your own name>",
    "certificate" : "MIIG7jCCBNagAwIBAXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXIe7+C/vwsdA="
}

Verify if your tenant is already configured.. </id> will have to be copied from above request which you passed in POST request

GET {{url}}/sap/c4c/api/v1/iam-service/oauth2InboundConfiguration/34f8b9d2-78c2-4617-bcf2-6eb36403c667
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Basic {{user}}:{{password}}

Use the token in API requests (Authorization: Bearer <token>).

OAuth2 JWT Bearer Assertion Flow

< This will be updated shortly>

 

Scopes

Scope is a mechanism in OAuth 2.0 to limit an application's access to a user's account. An OAuth 2.0 scope represents a list of resources that can be accessed by remote applications. They provide a way to limit the amount of access that is granted to an access token. For example, an access token issued to a client app may be granted READ and WRITE access to protected resources, or just READ access. You can implement your APIs to enforce any scope or combination of scopes you wish. So, if a client receives a token that has READ scope, and it tries to call an API endpoint that requires WRITE access, the call will fail.

OAuth2 Scope

while performing any API calls using OAuth2 token, you must need to check the Scope to see the permissions for different entities.. (READ or WRITE or both)

GET {{url}}/sap/c4c/api/v1/iam-service/oauth2Scope
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer {{accessToken}}

Check the individual scope which your external API is been used.

GET {{url}}/sap/c4c/api/v1/iam-service/oauth2Scope/<id>
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer {{accessToken}}

entry.title: Re: Instance Refresh Tool and New Learning Experience in...
entry.content:
@rahulbarvebd wrote:

Hello SAP Community,

We are planning an instance refresh for our SuccessFactors Learning (LMS) development and QA environments and have a few questions related to the process and the New Learning Experience:

  1. Is a customer with VSaaS LMS eligible to use the Instance Refresh Tool (IRT)?
  2. If eligible, can the tool be used for both BizX and LMS instances?
  3. During the instance refresh (manual or via IRT), will the new custom contents (such as custom cards, pages, and banners) that are part of the New Learning Experience in the source system replace those in the target system?
  4. Will the email notification templates in the source instance overwrite those in the target instance?
  5. Any additional information or best practices related to the New Learning Experience and instance refresh would be greatly appreciated.

Looking forward to your insights and experiences!

 

1. IRT is supported for VSaaS tenants as of 2H 2025. Blog-> Instance Refresh Tool (self-service Refresh) 1H202... - SAP Community

2. Yes, it can be used for both BizX & LMS.

3. Yes, New Learning Experience content in Target should get overwritten by the same from source.

4. Yes, email templates in target should get overwritten by the same from source.

5. You can refer to this KBA for general recommendations-> 2165346 - Learning Management System Manual Refresh Process

entry.title: Re: SAP Learning Admin Report to show users who completed...
entry.content:
Hi @paulstandley91 

The report 'User Curriculum Status Summary (CSV)' allows you to filter by user and/or by curriculum, and is also possible to filter on the status (Completed, Not Completed, or Both).

  • This report is located at Learning Administration > Reports > expand Curriculum Status.

Considering the scenario described, you can use the 'User Curriculum Status Summary (CSV)' report to filter by the required curriculum and only for users with a Completed status. It should return you a list of users that already completed the curriculum.

Best regards,

In documentation, I have seen only CN, OU,  O, and C used.

entry.title: Re: Success Factors Learning: Progress Restriction not wo...
entry.content:
Hi @MichelleWest 

For the program's setting "Progress Restriction" work properly, the items within the sections need to be set as Required.

  • 3441808 - Program Restriction Not Working

This happens because optional activities are not considered for the progress restriction.

  • 2511061 - How to make the completion of programs sections mandatory to move to next ones?

Best regards,

entry.title: Re: SAP SF LMS Item/class assignment
entry.content:
Hi @gopher93 

Please note that users cannot self-enroll into Items / Classes unless the Item and Class belong to a Library that the user has access to. Also, Classes can only be added to Libraries that the Item already belongs to.

This is the application's expected behavior: https://me.sap.com/notes/0002394095 

To have a different system behavior, it would be possible to have an enhancement request created for it (as per KBA 2090228), where the Learning Product Management team can further review and assess the requested functionality to be considered in a future release.

Best regards,

entry.content:
hi,

we have many Excel files stored in SharePoint.
These files keep changing daily, and you need to bring this updated data into Datasphere every day.

Till now, we used an Open Connector in BTP Integration Suite to pull data from SharePoint ‚Üí Datasphere.

But now:
Open Connectors will be stopped (deprecated) in 2026.
So we need another standard and supported way

entry.title: Re: Programs , content and SCORMs mass load
entry.content:
Hi @baoyk 

Regarding a tool to mass import programs, currently there is no such tool available within SAP SF LMS. There have been some enhancements requests on it, and customers are welcomed to vote for any open requests and/or create additional ones. For example:

  • HAVING A POSSIBILITY TO MASS UPLOAD PROGRAMS

For more details on enhancement requests, please check the KBA 2090228. In addition to this, your team may also check the possibility of a custom solution, by engaging your company's Partner and/or SAP Professional Services team (KBA 2149831).

Now, regarding the content objects (SCORM, .pdf, .ppt, etc.), it's possible to upload them directly into the SFTP and then massively create the content records within LMS via Item Connector:

  • 2568384 - How to mass upload content files to iContent and create entities?

However, please note that Learning connectors can import thousands of entities in the system, so it's highly recommend that customers engage with our Professional Services organization or a certified Learning implementation partner before attempting to use connectors or any data import.

  • Import Data to SAP SuccessFactors Learning

Best regards,

entry.title: Re: OOALV Implementation of Checkbox Click Event Issue
entry.content:
Hi, 

Can you try adding the below?

" After updating GT_ALV
LOOP AT er_data_changed->mt_good_cells ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_change>)
WHERE fieldname = 'SEL'.

READ TABLE gt_alv ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_real>) INDEX <fs_change>-row_id.
IF sy-subrc = 0.
<fs_change>-value = <fs_real>-sel. " reflect real status
ENDIF.
ENDLOOP.


er_data_changed->refresh = 'X'.


er_data_changed->modify_cell(
i_row_id = ls_mod-row_id
i_fieldname = 'SEL'
i_value = ls_alv-sel ).


IF go_alv IS BOUND.
DATA(ls_stable) = VALUE lvc_s_stbl( row = 'X' col = 'X' ).
go_alv->refresh_table_display( is_stable = ls_stable ).
ENDIF.

Best regards,

entry.content:
Hi @Helena_Branco_F ,

Can you please elaborate? As per KBA 3511612 > section 'Search Results - 2H25', the language filter is not part of this release.

Best regards,

entry.title: What is SAP Analytics Cloud preview tenant?
entry.content:
1- What is this preview tenant is meant for?
2- Can this be used for POC's or sandbox?

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: What is SAP Analytics Cloud preview tenant?
entry.content:
1- what is this preview tenant is meant for?
    A Preview tenant is a non-productive test environment that receives updates before they are released to general production tenants. It allows customers to test and evaluate new features in advance to ensure a smooth transition when the updates are eventually rolled out to their live system.
    These tenants are not meant for production work and are updated at a more frequent rate, such as bi-weekly or monthly, depending on the customer's release cycle. 
    Key characteristics of an SAC Preview tenant
2- Can this be used for POC's or sandbox?
    It was designed specifically for the scenario described above.

entry.title: Re: How to plan revenue in SAP S4 hana public cloud, for...
entry.content:
For Enterprise Projects in Public Cloud you need to use Financial Plan upload for all costs and revenues.  The both use category PLN.  Make sure the revenue is a negative amount.  And make sure all of your G/L accounts are in the correct G/L Account Hierarchy for EBRR and reporting to work.

I attached a screenshot of an upload file that worked.

entry.title: Safety Stock Behavior in V2 Reorder Point Planning ‚Äì Exclude from Available Stock Consumption
entry.content:
Hello All,

System : S4 HANA Public cloud

I am using MRP Type V2 (Automatic Reorder Point Planning) with lot size EX and a rounding value of 660. After the forecast calculation, the system proposed a reorder point of 869 and a safety stock of 515( service level 99.9%). Currently, safety stock is treated as a requirement and reduces the available stock, which prevents customer orders from consuming the available quantity. I want safety stock to be excluded from consuming available quantity. (refer screen shot)

My availability check (SR) is set to include safety stock, and even if I untick this option, the system behaves the same way. I do not want to manually remove safety stock from the material master.

Is there a way to achieve this without removing the safety stock indicator in the MRP type config? If I remove it, will the calculation differs? Or it just uses the safety calculation in the background and doesnt show or update in the material master ?

Thanks
